title: Beginners Ail-Purpose Symbolic Instructional Code" is the pro gramming language of most microcomputers
The part of the computer where information appears; The cath ode ray tube

note: as opposed to the computer programs (the software).
title: The computer machinery
The device used to transmit information into the computer or the device used to transmit information from the computer to the "outside" world
An attachment for a computer. examples: printer, disk drive, game paddles, etc

note: read only memory (ROM). Permanent information and instructions built into the microcomputer.
title: A question the computer asks. prompt character. A symbol that indicates that the computer is looking for input from the user. example: The "?" or the cursor. random access memory (RAM). Replaceable information and instruction cre ated for or with a microcomputer

note: software (s6ft war). Prepackaged program(s) for a computer. space bar. The long narrow bar at the bottom of the keyboard. When depressed, it generates a blank character on the display screen. storage (stor ij). The place where information is stored in a computer system.
title: The key a user presses when input is finished. screen (skren). The place where you see words and images on a computer. The cathode ray tube. simulation (sim yoo la shen). To represent the functioning of another system by the execution of a computer program
Takes in information, holds, and at a later time, returns the information. syntax (sjn taks). Formal rules for how a computer program is written in a spe cific computer language
